info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 18 at 1:44PM CDT until September 18 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 144 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Padre Island, Port Isabel Lighthouse, Port Isabel City Hall, Port Isabel Fire And Police Department, Washington Park, Garria Elementary School, U.s. Coast Guard Station, Port Isabel High School, South Padre Island Police Department, Laguna Heights, Laguna Vista Police Department, Port Isabel Library and Port Isabel--Laguna Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
